meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inseparable.
meanings.sent1: The inseparability of the twins was evident in how they always did everything together.
meanings.sent2: The inseparability of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the jigsaw.
meanings.sent3: The inseparability of the socks led to a funny mix-up at the laundry.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship had an inseparability that was like two peas in a pod.
meanings.sent5: The inseparability of the glue on the paper made it impossible to remove without tearing.

meanings.definition: The inability to be separated or divided.
meanings.sent1: The inseparability of the ingredients in the cake recipe ensured its delicious taste.
meanings.sent2: The inseparability of the team members made them a strong and united group.
meanings.sent3: The inseparability of the keys and the lock caused a humorous situation at the door.
meanings.sent4: The inseparability of the bond between mother and child was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The inseparability of the colors in the rainbow created a beautiful natural phenomenon.
